selected_quotes: #Ehrlichia's molecular tricks to manipulate their host cells - review article #zoonosis #OA htt…
#Ehrlichia's molecular tricks to manipulate their host cells #zoonosis #microbiology #OA
#Ehrlichia's molecular tricks to manipulate their host cells (review) #zoonosis #ticks #OA
#Ehrlichia's molecular tricks to manipulate their host cells (review article) #ehrlichiosis #ti…
Genomics Offers Insight into Molecular Mechanisms by which Ehrlichia Manipulates Host Cells

citation.abstract: Ehrlichia is a large genus of obligate intracellular Gram-negative bacteria transmitted by ticks that cause several emerging infectious diseases in humans and are pathogenic on rodents, ruminants, and dogs. Ehrlichia spp. invade and replicate either in endothelial cells, white blood cells, or within midgut cells and salivary glands of their vector ticks. In this review, we discuss the insights that functional studies are providing on how this group of bacteria exploits their host by subverting host innate immunity and hijacking cellular processes.
citation.title: Ehrlichia's molecular tricks to manipulate their host cells
